lit. Even so, a leading British
physicist,  Ernest  Lord  Rutherford,  insisted  that  the  splitting  of  the  atom
would not lead to the development of nuclear power, saying, “The energy
produced by the atom is a very poor kind of thing. Anyone who expects a
source of power from the transformation of these atoms is talking moon-
shine.”5Given  the  knowledge  available  at  the  time,  both  Einstein  and
Rutherford may have been justified in their claims, but their assertions were,
after all,
